reference_summary:
800 Words : Season 1 [Blu-ray] Pino Amenta (Director), Mike Smith (Director), Erik Thomson (Actor), Melina Vidler (Actor) & 1 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, TV ['Successful newspaper columnist George Turner (Erik Thomson, Packed to the Rafters) has his world turned upside down when his wife suddenly dies. Looking for a fresh start, George packs up and moves his two teenaged children, Shay (Melina Vidler) and Arlo (Benson Jack Anthony), from the bustle of Sydney to the picturesque seaside town of Weld, New Zealand. But the Turners’ new life doesn’t go as planned when they face a series of setbacks and meet the eccentric townsfolk, including handyman Woody (Rick Donald, Friends with Better Lives) and the “women of Weld”—four single ladies who are intrigued by the handsome widower and his offspring. Hailed for its “warmth and inclusiveness” (The Australian), this award-winning series is a heartfelt comedy/drama about a family searching for healing in the midst of tragedy.'] {'Genre': 'Drama/Television, Television', 'Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'James Griffin, Natalie Medlock, Cian Elyse White, Michelle Langstone, Mike Smith, Rick Donald, Anna Jullienne, Erik Thomson, Chris Hampson, Benson Jack Anthony, Emma Leonard, Pino Amenta, Melina Vidler, Maxine Fleming, Tim BalmeJames Griffin, Natalie Medlock, Cian Elyse White, Michelle Langstone, Mike Smith, Rick Donald, Anna Jullienne, Erik Thomson, Chris Hampson, Benson Jack Anthony, Emma Leonard, Pino Amenta, Melina Vidler, Maxine Fleming, Tim Balme See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.82 Ounces', 'Director': 'Pino Amenta, Mike Smith', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '6 hours and 3 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 23, 2020', 'Actors': 'Erik Thomson, Melina Vidler, Benson Jack Anthony, Rick Donald, Anna Jullienne', 'Producers': 'Chris Hampson', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Writers': 'James Griffin, Maxine Fleming, Tim Balme, Natalie Medlock', 'Number of discs': '2'} It's a wonderful DVD, story.
Arrived in perfect condition.
Thank you Great,funny story,excellently delivered and received when expected 800 Words: Season 3 Part 1 Erik Thomson (Actor) Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray ['As the award-winning dramedy returns, new challenges await newspaper columnist George Turner (Erik Thomson, Packed to the Rafters) and his family, now settled in a charming New Zealand community after moving from Australia. Following last season\'s harrowing boating accident, the townsfolk of Weld mount a search-and-rescue operation for the missing men, including the boyfriend of George\'s daughter, Shay (Melina Vidler). Meanwhile, George anxiously considers the possibility of becoming a father again as his editor Jan (Bridie Carter, McLeod\'s Daughters) goes into labor, but her twins\' paternity is still unknown. Later, George\'s teenage son, Arlo (Benson Jack Anthony), faces relationship problems, and George gets dragged into an elaborate scheme to help his friend Woody (Rick Donald, A Place to Call Home) out of a predicament that could ruin Woody\'s forthcoming wedding. Set against the stunning scenery of the New Zealand coast, this "amiable and touching" (The New York Times) series also stars Emma Leonard (Home and Away), Michelle Langstone (The Almighty Johnsons), and Jonny Brugh (What We Do in the Shadows).'] {'Genre': 'Drama/Television, Television', 'Contributor': 'Erik Thomson', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Publication Date': 'February 20, 2020', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.96 Ounces', 'Release date': 'February 20, 2020', 'Actors': 'Erik Thomson', 'Studio': 'Acorn Media', 'Number of discs': '2'} Arrived in exceptional condition and when expected. Fun story Heart Guy, The: Series 1 Rodger Corser (Actor), Nicole Da Silva (Actor), Peter Salmon (Director), Jeremy Sims (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD ['Gifted, but arrogant heart surgeon Hugh Knight (Rodger Corser, Glitch, The Doctor Blake Mysteries) leads a charmed life in Sydney. He believes his talent lets him live outside the rules—until an incident involving drugs and alcohol brings his world crashing down. Placed on probation and banned from performing surgery, Hugh is forced to retreat to his rarely-visited hometown of Whyhope in rural Australia. Working as a GP at an underfunded hospital under his no-nonsense new boss (Hayley McElhinney, The Babadook), Hugh struggles to re-acclimate to rural life. And his complicated family situation makes his fall from grace even worse. Between his politically-ambitious mother (Tina Bursill, Prisoner: Cell Block H), emotionally distant father (Steve Bisley, The Great Gatsby, Mad Max), and his ex-girlfriend Charlie (Nicole da Silva, Wentworth, Rush) now married to his younger brother, Hugh is constantly reminded why he left Whyhope. Can he start afresh with a clean slate or will his bad-boy tendencies end his medical career for good?'] {'Genre': 'Television', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Tina Bursill, Kriv Stenders, Matt Castley, Nicole Da Silva, Shalom Brune-Franklin, Jeremy Sims, Hayley McElhinney, Charles Wu, Belinda Bromilow, Steve Bisley, Rodger Corser, Peter Salmon, Ryan Johnson, Chloe BaylissTina Bursill, Kriv Stenders, Matt Castley, Nicole Da Silva, Shalom Brune-Franklin, Jeremy Sims, Hayley McElhinney, Charles Wu, Belinda Bromilow, Steve Bisley, Rodger Corser, Peter Salmon, Ryan Johnson, Chloe Bayliss See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4.8 Ounces', 'Director': 'Peter Salmon, Jeremy Sims, Kriv Stenders', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '8 hours and 9 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 19, 2017', 'Actors': 'Rodger Corser, Nicole Da Silva, Ryan Johnson, Tina Bursill, Hayley McElhinney', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Number of discs': '3'} Arrived in excellent condition, wonderful story Wonderful 800 Words: Season 2 Part 2 [Blu-ray] Erik Thomson (Actor), Melina Vidler (Actor), Mike Smith (Director), Michael Hurst (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, TV ['With his family back together, George Turner (Erik Thomson, Packed to the Rafters) and his kids, Shay and Arlo (Melina Vidler, Benson Jack Anthony), fall into the comfortable routine of life in the small, quirky New Zealand town of Weld. Arlo prepares for the new school term and tries to maintain a long-distance relationship, while Shay considers becoming an artist. George has a steady job writing for the local newspaper, and his budding relationship with Fiona (Michelle Langstone, The Almighty Johnsons) is the talk of the town. But shocking news from Jan (Bridie Carter, McLeod\'s Daughters) threatens to turn George\'s comfortable life upside down. This "explicitly heartwarming family tale" (The New York Times) also stars Rick Donald (A Place to Call Home), Emma Leonard (Home and Away), Anna Jullienne (The Blue Rose), and Ditch Davey (Spartacus: War of the Damned).'] {'Genre': 'Drama/Television, Television', 'Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'James Griffin, Cian Elyse White, Michelle Langstone, Rick Donald, Mike Smith, Anna Jullienne, Erik Thomson, Benson Jack Anthony, Sarah-Kate Lynch, Emma Leonard, Caroline Bell-Booth, Kate McDermott, Melina Vidler, Michael Hurst, Michael Beran, Tim Balme, Chris BaileyJames Griffin, Cian Elyse White, Michelle Langstone, Rick Donald, Mike Smith, Anna Jullienne, Erik Thomson, Benson Jack Anthony, Sarah-Kate Lynch, Emma Leonard, Caroline Bell-Booth, Kate McDermott, Melina Vidler, Michael Hurst, Michael Beran, Tim Balme, Chris Bailey See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.5 Ounces', 'Director': 'Mike Smith, Michael Hurst, Caroline Bell-Booth', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '6 hours and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 6, 2020', 'Actors': 'Erik Thomson, Melina Vidler, Benson Jack Anthony, Rick Donald, Anna Jullienne', 'Producers': 'Chris Bailey', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Writers': 'Kate McDermott, Michael Beran, James Griffin, Sarah-Kate Lynch, Tim Balme', 'Number of discs': '2'} Arrived in perfect condition, wonderful story Wonderful 800 Words: Season 3 Part 2 Erik Thomson (Actor) Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, TV ["Australian newspaper columnist George Turner (Erik Thomson, Packed to the Rafters) and his family have settled into their lives in New Zealand, but things are far from calm in their small coastal town. Following the wedding of his friend Woody (Rick Donald, A Place to Call Home), George begins dating someone new, providing endless fodder for the gossiping townsfolk. George's teenagers face their own relationship issues as Shay (Melina Vidler) tries to get over her messy breakup, and Arlo (Benson Jack Anthony) becomes romantically involved with two girls at once. Later, the citizens of Weld fear that their town may be taken over by a neighboring community, and the Turners are rocked by revelations about the death of George's wife a few years earlier."] {'Genre': 'Drama/Television, Television', 'Contributor': 'Erik Thomson', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Publication Date': 'February 20, 2020', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 8.32 Ounces', 'Release date': 'February 20, 2020', 'Actors': 'Erik Thomson', 'Studio': 'Acorn Media', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Arrived in perfect condition, wonderful story Wonderful The Heart Guy: Series 3 Rodger Corser (Actor), Nicole da Silva (Actor), Geoff Bennett (Director), Lucy Gaffy (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, TV {'Genre': 'Television', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Uli Latukefu, Ben Chessell, Tina Bursill, Nicole da Silva, Geoff Bennett, Matt Castley, Brittany Clark, Jennifer Leacey, Lucy Gaffy, Hayley McElhinney, Charles Wu, Steve Bisley, Belinda Bromilow, Rodger Corser, Ian Watson, Ryan Johnson, Chloe BaylissUli Latukefu, Ben Chessell, Tina Bursill, Nicole da Silva, Geoff Bennett, Matt Castley, Brittany Clark, Jennifer Leacey, Lucy Gaffy, Hayley McElhinney, Charles Wu, Steve Bisley, Belinda Bromilow, Rodger Corser, Ian Watson, Ryan Johnson, Chloe Bayliss See more', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Runtime': '7 hours and 53 minutes'} Arrived in perfect condition, wonderful story Wonderful Heart Guy Series 4 Rodger Corser (Actor), Nicole da Silva (Actor), Erin White (Director), Geoff Bennet (Director) & 1 more Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD ['After serving out his probation in his rural Australian hometown and saving the family farm, hotshot surgeon Hugh Knight (Rodger Corser, “The Doctor Blake Mysteries”) is flying high. profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user continues to express a strong affinity for heartfelt comedy/drama narratives that explore family dynamics, personal growth, and community interactions. Their latest purchase reinforces their enthusiasm for strong character arcs and emotional storytelling, especially within rural settings.

- **Media Format:** The user remains dedicated to physical media formats, particularly valuing DVDs with high-quality presentations. Their openness to subtitled formats emphasizes their appreciation for diverse narratives.

- **Quality Expectations:** They uphold high standards for content quality, consistently rating their purchases above 4.6. This indicates a preference for well-received content that delivers emotional depth and relatability.

- **User Feedback:** The user frequently provides positive reviews, highlighting product condition and storytelling quality. Their most recent feedback praised the perfect condition of the item and commended the wonderful nature of the story, resulting in a perfect rating.

- **Interests in Storytelling:** They are drawn to narratives highlighting deep relationships and complex community dynamics, particularly those that balance humor with emotional resonance and focus on personal challenges and growth.

- **Community Engagement:** The user demonstrates a continued interest in emotionally rich narratives that celebrate social bonds, underscoring their passion for character-driven storytelling rooted in family and community life, as evidenced by their recent interactions.
